title: Clues Left Online Might Aid Leak Investigation, Officials Say
description: A large number of people potentially had access to the Pentagon intelligence documents posted on social media.

title: Saudi Arabia and Houthis Hold Peace Talks in Yemen: What to Know
description: The surprise rapprochement between Saudi Arabia and Iran, whose rivalry fueled the war, has raised a glimmer of hope for a breakthrough in resolving one of the world’s worst crises.

title: What Does ‘Wrongfully Detained’ Mean? What We Know About WSJ Reporter and Others
description: Evan Gershkovich, a reporter for The Wall Street Journal, is the latest American to bear the designation, which indicates that the U.S. government sees him as the equivalent of a political hostage.

title: Your Tuesday Briefing: China’s Display of Force Around Taiwan
description: Also, President Biden prepares to visit Northern Ireland and Ireland.

title: Netanyahu Reverses Firing of Yoav Gallant, Israel’s Defense Minister
description: Yoav Gallant was dismissed last month after expressing concern about the pace of Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s judicial overhaul plan.

title: Italy’s Coast Guard Rescues Hundreds of Migrants in ‘Chaotic’ Few Days at Sea
description: About 2,000 people have been rescued since Friday, and ships were dispatched to help boats carrying 1,200 more on Monday as disquiet grows about the high numbers undertaking the risky crossing.

title: Poland and Ukraine Reach Temporary Solution After Grain Supply Dispute
description: Poland, Romania and Hungary, all of which border Ukraine and are members of the European Union, have struggled with a glut of grain and other Ukrainian agricultural products since last year.

title: Lethal Surprises Hidden in the Grass: Russia’s Trip Wires and Land Mines
description: As Moscow’s troops set booby traps in forests, houses and backyards, finding them has become a dangerous art for Ukrainian soldiers.

title: Russia Adopts ‘Scorched Earth’ Tactics in Bakhmut, a Ukrainian Commander Says
description: Gen. Oleksandr Syrsky visited Bakhmut on Sunday and said the situation is difficult but under control.

title: Dalai Lama Apologizes Over an Exchange With a Boy
description: In a video, the 87-year-old Tibetan spiritual leader sticks out his tongue and asks the child to “suck” it. His office said the actions had been lighthearted.

title: Ukraine’s forces say they have so far thwarted Moscow’s efforts to sever supply lines around Bakhmut.
China Brandishes Military Options in Exercises Around Taiwan
description: The People’s Liberation Army’s ships, planes and troops held three days of drills in a spectacle designed to warn Taiwan against challenging Beijing.

title: Biden Must Tread Rocky Path in Northern Ireland Before Tending Roots
description: President Biden, who has ancestral ties to Ireland, will mark the 25th anniversary of the Good Friday Agreement in Northern Ireland before heading south.

title: Diplomatic forums, the Security Council and India: What to watch for this week.
The Jailing of Evan Gershkovich
description: We tell you the story of the American reporter who has been imprisoned in Russia.

title: China Sentences Leading Rights Activists to 14 and 12 Years in Prison
description: Xu Zhiyong and Ding Jiaxi were detained after organizing a small seaside gathering of activists to discuss human rights. Their lengthy sentences point to Beijing’s intolerance of dissent.

title: Truffle Hunting in Syria, Once a Beloved Pastime, Is Now a Danger
description: A cherished spring tradition has become a perilous gamble to earn a bit of desperately needed income during an economic crisis after 12 years of war. Dozens of foragers have been killed already this year.

title: Northern Ireland 25 Years After the Good Friday Agreement, in Photos
description: As it commemorates a quarter-century since the Good Friday Agreement, the region is searching for its place and trying to move on from a legacy of bloody divisions.

title: Your Monday Briefing
description: A Ukraine war documents leak.

title: ‘Every Day Is Scary’: Ukrainian Soldiers Learn to Cope With Trauma
description: A team of Ukrainian military psychologists is training soldiers to confront stress and trauma after a year of harsh fighting on the battlefield. But as Russia’s war grinds on, their work is getting harder.

title: The World Bank Is Getting a New Chief. Will He Pivot Toward Climate Action?
description: Under pressure from world leaders, development experts and shareholders, the bank opens its spring meeting on Monday, poised for big changes.

title: Eight People Missing in Marseille After Building Collapses
description: The five-story building, near the French city’s old port, collapsed after an explosion whose cause was not immediately clear.

title: What to Know About the Leaked U.S. Intelligence Reports
description: A trove of classified documents dribbling onto the web has tongues wagging.
